{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3684409,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-19T01:11:01.323Z","cooked":"

Hi everybody,

We used Advantagescope last season and generally liked it, but there‚Äôs one thing that I can‚Äôt figure out, and I‚Äôm hoping folks here might be able to point me in the right direction.

Before Advantagescope, we used Glass, and one of the things that‚Äôs great about Glass is that it persists all the data it hears, for as long as it runs. So we can put up a time-series chart, run an experiment, push new code, and run the experiment again, and all the data shows up in that chart.

With Advantagescope connected ‚Äúlive,‚Äù to NT, it seems like when we restart the robot code, Advantagescope also restarts its history, which makes it hard to iterate.

Is there a way to get Advantagescope to merely retain everything forever (until ‚Äúquit‚Äù), in the ‚Äúlive‚Äù mode, like Glass does?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-07-19T20:13:14.788Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":158,"readers_count":157,"score":106.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504404,"topic_slug":"advantagescope-data-history","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/advantagescope-data-history/504404/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3684556,"name":"Eric (319)","username":"EKM_319","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ekm_319/{size}/230932_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-19T02:55:39.629Z","cooked":"

So i have no idea if you can preserve past data in the tool.

However. If you‚Äôre saving logs to a usb from the rio you can play multiple logs back at once to compare.

Hope that helps!

i agree that advantagescope with usb logs works fine, but that‚Äôs not the scenario. we iterate things like auton setpoints and pid/profile parameters through the deploy process.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-07-19T03:13:41.252Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":28.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":504404,"topic_slug":"advantagescope-data-history","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/advantagescope-data-history/504404/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3684587,"name":"Jonah Bonner","username":"jonahb55","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jonahb55/{size}/194474_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-19T03:36:30.340Z","cooked":"

This isn‚Äôt something that AdvantageScope currently supports, but feel free to open an issue to put the feature on the backlog. Persisting data across robot code restarts may actually be a good fit in 2027 (SystemCore) since timestamps will be measured from the controller boot time rather than code startup. One of the practical issues with implementing this on the RIO is that the timestamps between multiple code restarts would conflict with each other, so we would need to modify the timestamps published by the robot to keep the visualization sensible.

truher:

we iterate things like auton setpoints and pid/profile parameters through the deploy process

Unrelated to the limitations of AdvantageScope, our experience is that trying to tune parameters by redeploying code can become tedious very quickly. If you have the opportunity, I would recommend looking into ways to tune parameters without redeploying code. There are lots of solutions out there with different strengths, but some of the popular ones include the WPILib Preferences class, 6328‚Äôs own TunableNumber class, or live configuration with vendor utilities for onboard PID. It‚Äôs very likely that WPILib will also get some utilities to help with this in 2027.

thanks, I‚Äôm aware of those options. the main reason we do it the tedious way is so that there‚Äôs just one way, and that way ends up checked in (permanent, reviewable, usable by other projects).
